snippet: The Bloomberg administration, in a push to erase a federal judge’s rulings on police stop-and-frisk practices, asked a federal appeals court on Saturday to vacate her decisions, which had ordered sweeping reforms.
abstract: Bloomberg administration, in push to erase federal judge’s rulings on police stop-and-frisk practices, asks federal appeals court to vacate decisions made by Judge Shira A Sheindlin, who had ordered sweeping reforms.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: The Bloomberg administration, in a push to erase a federal judge’s rulings on police stop-and-frisk practices, asked a federal appeals court on Saturday to vacate her decisions, which had ordered sweeping reforms.

headline.main: New York City Asks Court to Vacate Rulings on Stop-and-Frisk Tactic
headline.print_headline: City Asks Court to Vacate Rulings on Policing Tactic
